extendedIngredients.name: baby arugula
extendedIngredients.original: 1 1/2 cups packed baby arugula (1 1/2 ozs), divided

extendedIngredients.name: fava beans
extendedIngredients.original: 1 cup shelled fresh fava beans (1 1/4 lbs in pods) or shelled fresh or frozen edamame (soybeans; 3/4 lbs in pods)
extendedIngredients.originalName: shelled fresh fava beans (1 1/4 lbs in pods) or shelled fresh or frozen edamame (soybeans; 3/4 lbs in pods)

extendedIngredients.name: olive oil
extendedIngredients.original: 1/4 cup plus 1 Tbsp extra-virgin olive oil, divided, plus additional for drizzling
extendedIngredients.originalName: extra-virgin olive oil, divided, plus additional for drizzling

extendedIngredients.name: pecorino
extendedIngredients.original: 3 Tbsps grated Pecorino Toscano or Parmigiano-Reggiano

title: Arugula And Fava-bean Crostini
summary: Arugulan And Fava-bean Crostini requires roughly 10 minutes from start to finish. This recipe makes 8 servings with 178 calories, 5g of protein, and 8g of fat each. For 57 cents per serving, this recipe covers 7% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. Head to the store and pick up garlic clove, olive oil, pecorino toscano, and a few other things to make it today. Only a few people really liked this hor d'oeuvre. It is brought to you by The Bitten Word. 3 people found this recipe to be delicious and satisfying. It is a very reasonably priced recipe for fans of Mediterranean food. It is a good option if you're following a vegetarian diet. With a spoonacular score of 65%, this dish is pretty good. Similar recipes include Arugulan and Fava-Bean Crostini, Fava Bean Crostini, and Fava Bean and Manchego Crostini.

winePairing.pairingText: Italian works really well with Chianti, Trebbiano, and Verdicchio. Italians know food and they know wine. Trebbiano and Verdicchio are Italian white wines that pair well with fish and white meat, while Chianti is a great Italian red for heavier, bolder dishes. The Casan Emma Chianti Classico with a 4.8 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 21 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Casa Emma Chianti Classico
productMatches.description: Casa Emma Chianti Classico D.O.C.G is an elegant wine with a floreal bouquet and cherry hints. It has a balanced freshness, good structure and velvety tannins. Aged for 1 year in 500 liter barrels, it has an intense ruby red color with purple reflections. With a lingering finish with good acidity and minerality, it is perfect to pair with pasta and cold cuts.
